c74object.name: nw.grainpulse~
c74object.digest: Trigger grains with a pulse signal
c74object.description: Outputs a single grain whenever a 0 to 1 transition is received, like those found in pulse control signals generated by the train~ object. Because it does not rely on the scheduler, this allows for sample-accurate triggering and enables a higher density of grains than the nw.grainbang~ object. The sound source and window shape used by this object for grain production must each loaded into the buffer~ objects specified by two required arguments.

inlet.digest: Pulse signal. Grains triggered on 0 to 1 transition.
Sound offset in ms. Where to start reading the sound buffer.
Grain duration in ms. How long grain should last.
Sample increment. Effects perceived pitch, 1.0 = normal.

outlet.digest: Audio signal: audio channel 2 COMING SOON
Audio signal: sample count since playback started. -1 = no playback.

objarg.name: sound-buffer-name
objarg.description: The first argument names the buffer~ object whose sample memory contains a source source used by this object for grain production.

objarg.name: window-buffer-name
objarg.description: The second argument names the buffer~ object whose sample memory contains a window function used by this object for grain production.

method.name: int
method.description: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to control sound offset, grain duration, sample increment and gain multiplier. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, float and int messages will be ignored.

method.name: float
method.description: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to control sound offset, grain duration, sample increment and gain multiplier. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, float and int messages will be ignored.

method.name: signal
method.description:
In inlet 1: 0 to 1 transition from a pulse signal will trigger grain production. While a grain is sounding, the object passes any additional pulses that are received to the overflow outlet, which allows several nw.grainpulse~ objects to be chained together and form a multi-voice grain generator.
After a grain begins sounding, changes received by the following inlets will be deferred to the start of the next grain:
In inlet 2: Defines the offset in milliseconds from the beginning of the sound buffer~ where processing should start reading for grain production.
In inlet 3: Defines the duration in milliseconds of the grain.
In inlet 4: Defines the sample increment used while reading sound buffer~ contents. This changes the perceived pitch, with 1.0 resulting in normal playback. The absolute value of any negative numbers are used to prevent buffer overrun errors. If backward playback is desired, use the reverse 1 message.
In inlet 5: Defines the gain multiplier. All values within a grain will be scaled by this number, with 1.0 resulting in no change.

method.name: setSound
method.digest: Set the name of the sound buffer~ used for grain production.
method.description: The word setSound, followed by the name of a buffer~ object, uses that object's sample memory as source sound for grain production. Changes sent by the setSound message are deferred to the start of the next grain.

method.name: setWin
method.digest: Set the name of the window buffer~ used for grain production.
method.description: The word setWin, followed by the name of a buffer~ object, uses that object's sample memory as a window function for grain production. Changes sent by the setWin message are deferred to the start of the next grain.

method.name: reverse
method.digest: Read the defined buffer~ segment backwards. Default is off.
method.description: A reverse 1 message will play the defined buffer~ segment backwards. A reverse 0 message will play the defined buffer~ segment forward. Changes sent by the reverse message are deferred to the start of the next segment.

method.name: sndInterp
method.digest: Use interpolation while reading samples from the sound buffer~. Default is on.
method.description: An sndInterp 1 message will use linear interpolation while reading from the sound buffer~. An sndInterp 0 message will use no interpolation while reading from the sound buffer~.

method.name: winInterp
method.digest: Use interpolation while reading samples from the window buffer~. Default is on.
method.description: An winInterp 1 message will use linear interpolation while reading from the window buffer~. An winInterp 0 message will use no interpolation while reading from the window buffer~.

method.name: getinfo
method.digest: Post information about object to Max window
method.description: Retrieves basic information about the object author and when the object was last updated. Date can be used to identify different versions of the objects in circulation.
